result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin Roland Schoonover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Firearm by Felon, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: New probation case form

Defendant Devin Roland Schoonover in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called Appearances given.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to the charge.   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.  Arguements 

Court orders:
One year probation w/held - not opposed to it being served in Rock County or any County that would accept the deft.
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted and agent feels it is not necessary
5 days jail w/huber on or before 10/12/15 @ 9:00 am not opposed to being served in Rock County
243 SAvage be forfeited.  The other rifle can be returned to Amanda Miles unless forfeited in other case.
3 days sentence credit
